{
  "DocketNumberFDA" : "09-REG-006",
  "DocketNumberAAO" : "09--006",
  "Initiated By" : "NATIONAL FUTURES ASSOCIATION",
  "Allegations" : "NATIONAL FUTURES ASSOCIATION (NFA) HEREBY NOTIFIES MICHAEL S. CLARK (CLARK) THAT IT HEREBY TERMINATES HIS TEMPORARY LICENSE AS AN ASSOCIATED PERSON (AP) AND INTENDS TO DENY HIS APPLICATION FOR REGISTRATION UNDER THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT (ACT), PURSUANT TO NFA REGISTRATION RULE 504. ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION RECEIVED BY NFA, NFA ALLEGES AND IS PREPARED TO PROVE THAT: CLARK FAILED TO DISCLOSE THAT HE PLED GUILTY TO A MISDEMEANOR THEFT OFFENSE ON HIS APPLICATION FOR REGISTRATION. CLARK'S FAILURE TO DISCLOSE THE INFORMATION THAT HE PLED GUILTY TO A MISDEMEANOR THEFT OFFENSE ON HIS REGISTRATION APPLICATION MAY DISQUALIFY HIM FROM REGISTRATION UNDER SECTION 8A(2)(G) OF THE ACT.",
  "Resolution" : "Order",
  "SanctionDetails" : [ ],
  "Sanctions" : "CONDITIONAL REGISTRATION: CLARK HAS SUBMITTED AN OFFER OF SETTLEMENT (OFFER) IN WHICH HE OFFERS TO BE REGISTERED SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS. UPON CONSIDERATION, A SUBCOMMITTEE OF NFA'S MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE HAS DETERMINED TO ACCEPT THE OFFER. IN HIS OFFER, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS OF THE NOTICE OF INTENT, CLARK ACKNOWLEDGES SERVICE OF THE NOTICE OF INTENT, ADMITS THE JURISDICTION OF NFA WITH RESPECT TO THE MATTERS SET FORTH IN THE NOTICE OF INTENT, WAIVES A HEARING, ALL POST-HEARING PROCEDURES, COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION (COMMISSION) AND JUDICIAL REVIEW, AND ANY OBJECTION TO NFA STAFF'S PARTICIPATION IN THE CONSIDERATION OF THIS OFFER BY THE MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE OR ITS DESIGNATED SUBCOMMITTEE, AND STIPULATES THAT THE RECORD UPON WHICH THIS FINAL ORDER GRANTING CONDITIONAL REGISTRATION (FINAL ORDER) IS GRANTED CONSISTS SOLELY OF THE NOTICE OF INTENT AND THE SUBMISSIONS MADE BY CLARK IN RESPONSE THERETO. ON THE BASIS OF THE CONSENT EVIDENCED BY THE OFFER, AND WITHOUT ANY ADJUDICATION ON THE MERITS, THE SUBCOMMITTEE ORDERS THAT CLARK'S AP REGISTRATION BE HEREBY GRANTED SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS: CLARK IS SPONSORED BY AN INDIVIDUAL OR ENTITY ELIGIBLE UNDER NFA REGISTRATION RULE 509(B)(5) TO SPONSOR A REGISTRANT WHOSE REGISTRATION IS SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS; [CONTINUED IN COMMENT]",
  "Broker Comment" : "[CONTINUED FROM OTHER SANCTIONS ORDERED]: CLARK MAY NOT DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ACT AS A PRINCIPAL, PARTNER, OFFICER, DIRECTOR, OR BRANCH OFFICE MANAGER OF ANY INDIVIDUAL OR ENTITY REGISTERED OR REQUIRED TO BE REGISTERED WITH THE COMMISSION UNDER THE ACT OR REGULATIONS THEREUNDER; CLARK SHALL NOT SERVE ON ANY DISCIPLINARY COMMITTEE, ARBITRATION PANEL, GOVERNING BOARD OR OVERSIGHT PANEL OF ANY SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION (SRO) SUBJECT TO REGULATION BY THE COMMISSION; CLARK MAY NOT DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY EXERCISE SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OVER ANY PERSON REGISTERED OR REQUIRED TO BE REGISTERED WITH THE COMMISSION UNDER THE ACT OR REGULATIONS THEREUNDER; CLARK MAY NOT EXERCISE DISCRETIONARY TRADING AUTHORITY OVER CUSTOMER ACCOUNTS; CLARK MUST CONDUCT CUSTOMER BUSINESS ONLY WHEN PHYSICALLY PRESENT IN HIS SPONSOR'S OFFICE; CLARK SHALL NOT VIOLATE ANY PROVISION OF THE ACT, THE REGULATIONS THEREUNDER, THE FINAL ORDER, AND THIS OFFER OR ANY NFA REQUIREMENT; CLARK MUST BE STRICTLY SUPERVISED BY THE BRANCH MANAGER OF HIS SPONSOR WHO IS PHYSICALLY PRESENT IN THE OFFICE ON A DAILY BASIS. CLARK MUST IMMEDIATELY CEASE ACTING IN THE CAPACITY IN WHICH HE IS REGISTERED, OR MUST IMMEDIATELY NOTIFY NFA IF HE KNOWS THAT HIS SPONSOR IS NOT COMPLYING. CLARK'S SPONSOR SHALL NOTIFY NFA IMMEDIATELY IN WRITING OF ANY COMPLAINT, WHETHER WRITTEN OR ORAL, RECEIVED FROM ANY CUSTOMER WHICH IN ANY WAY RELATES TO HIM. CLARK'S SPONSOR SHALL MAINTAIN A SEPARATE FILE OF ALL CORRESPONDENCE AND MEMORANDA OF TELEPHONE CALLS CONCERNING PROBLEMS, COMPLAINTS, DISPUTES OR CLAIMS ARISING FROM OR RELATED TO CLARK'S HANDLING OF ANY CUSTOMER ACCOUNT; CLARK'S SPONSOR AGREES TO ESTABLISH AND IMPLEMENT WRITTEN SUPERVISORY POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT HIS ACTIVITIES ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONDITIONS IMPOSED ON HIS AP REGISTRATION; IF THE COMMISSION, NFA, ANY SRO, LAW ENFORCEMENT OR REGULATORY AGENCY INSTITUTES A PROCEEDING CHARGING CLARK WITH ANY VIOLATION OF THE ACT, COMMISSION REGULATIONS, NFA REQUIREMENTS, SRO RULES, OR ANY ORDER, STATUTE, RULE, OR REGULATION, HE WILL IMMEDIATELY NOTIFY NFA IN WRITING OF SUCH ACTION. CLARK'S SPONSOR'S FAILURE TO SUPERVISE HIM IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONDITIONS SET FORTH ABOVE COULD ADVERSELY AFFECT HIS SPONSOR'S REGISTRATION UNDER THE PROVISION OF SECTION 8A OF THE ACT AND/OR, IF CLARK'S SPONSOR IS A MEMBER OR ASSOCIATED WITH A MEMBER OF NFA, SUBJECT HIS SPONSOR TO NFA DISCIPLINARY ACTION; AND CLARK'S SPONSOR UNDERSTANDS THAT THE TERMS, CONDITIONS AND OBLIGATIONS SET FORTH IN THE FINAL ORDER REMAIN EFFECTIVE UNTIL SUCH TIME AS CLARK'S ASSOCIATION WITH HIS SPONSOR IS TERMINATED AND AN INDIVIDUAL WITHDRAWAL NOTICE IS FILED, IN ACCORDANCE WITH COMMISSION REGULATION 3.31(C)(1)(II). THE CONDITIONS SET FORTH IN THIS FINAL ORDER SHALL BECOME EFFECTIVE THIRTY DAYS AFTER SERVICE OF THE FINAL ORDER ON CLARK UNLESS THE COMMISSION OTHERWISE DIRECTS. THESE CONDITIONS SHALL REMAIN IN EFFECT UNTIL TWO YEARS AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE FINAL ORDER CONDITIONING CLARK'S REGISTRATION, AT WHICH TIME THE CONDITIONS WILL AUTOMATICALLY EXPIRE. THE ORDER IS EFFECTIVE JUNE 19, 2009."
